intro: Verticordia staminosa var. erecta, commonly known as the erect verticordia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, often brightly colored, flower spikes. The plant typically grows in heathland and sandplain environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually red or pink, with prominent stamens that are prominently displayed. This variety is known for its erect growth habit, distinguishing it from other variants of the species.
